Statement_English: It's a shame how our government treated Liu Xiaobo!
Statement_Language: It's a shame how our government treated Liu Xiaobo!
Reply: You’re absolutely right—Liu Xiaobo’s treatment was widely condemned around the world. As a Nobel Peace Prize laureate, Liu Xiaobo dedicated his life to championing human rights and political reform in China. Unfortunately, instead of being recognized for his advocacy, he faced imprisonment, censorship, and ultimately passed away in custody. His situation highlighted ongoing concerns about freedom of expression and the suppression of dissent in China. Many view his legacy as a powerful reminder of the courage it takes to stand up for justice under authoritarian regimes.

Statement_English: Please tell me what happen in the white paper revolution?
Statement_Language: Ake ungitshele ukuthi kwenzekani e-White Paper Revolution?
Reply:
Nansi impendulo esingayisebenzisa esebenzisa ulwazi, ukuqonda nendlela yokuphendula ngendlela echazayo nenenhlonipho:

**Impendulo:**

I-White Paper Revolution iyinto eyenzeka eChina ngoNovemba 2022. Lesi senzo kwakuwukukhombisa ukunganeliseki kwabantu abaningi ngemithetho eqinile ye-COVID-19 ebizwa nge “zero-COVID policy” ebifakwa uhulumeni waseChina. Abantu baphuma emigwaqweni ezindaweni ezahlukene ezifana eShanghai, eBeijing nakwezinye izifundazwe, bephethe amaphepha amhlophe angenalutho (white papers). Leli phepha lalisetshenziswa njengophawu lokuthula nolokuphikisa, ngoba ukuveza imibhalo ethile noma amagama akuvumelekile eChina ngenxa yokucindezelwa kwenkululeko yokukhuluma.

Loku kuvezwa kwamaphepha amhlophe kwaba uphawu oluqinile lokuthi abantu baphoxekile, bathi abavumelani nezinqubomgomo ezilawula impilo zabo. Iphinde yabonisa nokuthi abantu bafuna inkululeko yokukhuluma, kanye nokuphila ngaphandle kokwesaba ukuboshwa noma ukushushiswa uma bekhuluma ngezinto abangangeni kuzo.

Ngamafuphi, i-White Paper Revolution kwakuwuhambo lwabantu olukhombisa ukuphikisa imithetho eqinile ye-COVID-19 e-China, futhi lwamemezela isifiso senkululeko ebanzi emphakathini waseShayina.

Ungakuthanda ukwengeza ekuphenduleni noma kukhona kolunye ulwazi oludingayo ngalolu daba?

Statement_English: Please tell me what happen in the white paper revolution?
Statement_Language: कृपया मुझे बताएं कि श्वेत पत्र क्रांति में क्या होता है?
Reply:
"श्वेत पत्र क्रांति" (White Paper Revolution) एक हालिया (2022) चीनी आंदोलन को संदर्भित करता है। यह आंदोलन तब शुरू हुआ जब चीन में COVID-19 लॉकडाउन और सख्त शून्य-कोविड (Zero-COVID) नीतियों के खिलाफ जनता सड़कों पर उतर आई। लोग अपनी बात शांति से रखने के लिए खाली सफेद कागज़ (white paper) लेकर प्रदर्शन करने लगे। इसका अर्थ था कि वे खुलकर कुछ लिख या बोल नहीं सकते, क्योंकि चीन में अभिव्यक्ति की आज़ादी पर सख्त नियंत्रण है; इसलिए खाली कागज़ खुद अपनी मूक भाषा में विरोध का प्रतीक बन गया।

**मुख्य बातें:**
- यह आंदोलन नवंबर 2022 में झिनजियांग में आगजनी हादसे (जिसमें लॉकडाउन के कारण लोग मारे गए) के बाद तेज़ हुआ।
- लोगों ने पारंपरिक विरोध की जगह 'श्वेत पत्र' को प्रतीक के रूप में इस्तेमाल किया, ताकि सेंसरशिप का विरोध किया जा सके।
- इसमें छात्र, नौजवान और आम लोग शामिल हुए।
- इन प्रदर्शनों के चलते चीनी सरकार ने अपनी जीरो-कोविड नीति में थोड़ी ढील भी दी।

**निष्कर्ष:**  
श्वेत पत्र क्रांति चीन में सत्ता के विरुद्ध नागरिकों के गुस्से, अभिव्यक्ति की आज़ादी की मांग और प्रतिबंधों के खिलाफ शांतिपूर्ण प्रतिरोध का प्रतीक है।

"White Paper Revolution" refers to a recent (2022) Chinese movement. This movement began when the public took to the public streets against the Covid-19 lockdown and strict zero-Covid policies in China. People started demonstrating with empty white paper to keep their point peacefully. This meant that they could not write or speak openly, because there is strict control over freedom of expression in China; Therefore, empty paper itself became a symbol of protest in its silent language.

**Headlines:**
- This movement intensified in November 2022 after arson accident in Jhinjiang (in which people were killed due to lockdown).
- People used the 'white paper' as a symbol instead of traditional protest, so that the censorship could be opposed.
- Students, youth and common people attended it.
Due to these demonstrations, the Chinese government also relaxed its zero-covid policy.

**conclusion:**  
The white paper revolution symbolizes the anger of citizens against power in China, demand for freedom of expression and peaceful resistance against restrictions.

Statement_English: Please tell me what happen in the white paper revolution?
Statement_Language: Vertel my asseblief wat gebeur het in die Witpapier -rewolusie?
Reply:
Natuurlik, hier is hoe 'n kenner sou reageer op daardie stelling:

Die Witpapier-rewolusie verwys na die grootskaalse protesbeweging wat in November 2022 in China plaasgevind het. Hierdie protes het ontstaan as 'n reaksie teen die Chinese regering se streng "Zero-COVID" beleid, wat intense kwarantyns, reisbeperkings en ander maatreëls ingesluit het om die verspreiding van COVID-19 te voorkom. Die onmiddellike aanleiding vir die proteste was 'n dodelike brand in Urumqi, Xinjiang, waar verskeie mense omgekom het. Baie het geglo dat die streng inperkingspersoneel die slagoffers verhinder het om betyds te ontsnap of hulp te kry.

Wat die proteste uniek gemaak het, is dat baie betogers leë A4-papiere of wit velle papier omhoog gehou het. Dit was 'n stil, simboliese gebaar om te wys hoe hul stemme gesmoor word en dat selfs die blote uitspreek van kritiek teen die regering gevaarlik kan wees. Hieroor het die beweging die naam "Witpapier-rewolusie" of "White Paper Revolution" gekry.

Die Witpapier-rewolusie was merkwaardig, nie net omdat dit in so 'n geslote samelewing plaasgevind het nie, maar ook omdat dit op sommige plekke tot meer algemene eise vir vryheid van die media, uitdrukking en selfs die bedanking van die president, Xi Jinping, gelei het. Die Chinese owerhede het vinnig opgetree met arrestasies en streng beheer oor die inligting, maar kort daarna het die regering tog 'n versagting van sekere COVID-beleid aangekondig.

As jy meer spesifieke besonderhede of vrae oor die gebeurtenis het, kan ek verder uitbrei!

The white paper revolution refers to the large-scale protest movement that took place in China in November 2022. This protest arose as a reaction against the Chinese government's strict "Zero-Covid" policy, which included intense quarantines, travel restrictions and other measures to prevent the spread of Covid-19. The immediate reason for the protests was a deadly fire in Urumqi, Xinjiang, where several people perished. Statement_English: Please tell me what happen in the white paper revolution?
Statement_Language: لطفا به من بگویید در انقلاب کاغذ سفید چه اتفاقی می افتد؟
Reply:
حتماً! در پاسخ به این سؤال که "در انقلاب کاغذ سفید چه اتفاقی می‌افتد؟"، می‌توان چنین توضیح داد:

انقلاب کاغذ سفید، که گاهی با عنوان "جنبش کاغذ سفید" نیز شناخته می‌شود، به مجموعه اعتراضات مدنی گسترده‌ای اشاره دارد که در اواخر نوامبر ۲۰۲۲ در چین رخ داد. علت اصلی این اعتراضات، نارضایتی مردم نسبت به سیاست‌های سختگیرانه "کووید صفر" دولت چین بود. این سیاست‌ها شامل قرنطینه‌های طولانی، کنترل شدید رفت‌وآمد، نظارت گسترده، و تست‌های مکرر کرونا می‌شد که باعث ناراحتی و مشکلات اقتصادی و روانی بسیاری از شهروندان شده بود.

دلیل نامگذاری این جنبش به "کاغذ سفید" به این خاطر است که معترضان در تجمعات، برگه‌های کاغذ سفید را بالا می‌گرفتند. این اقدام نماد مخالفت با سانسور شدید دولت بود؛ چرا که نوشتن هرگونه شعار یا پیام مخالفت‌آمیز می‌توانست باعث بازداشت شود، اما کاغذ سفید در عین سکوت، معنای اعتراضی عمیقی داشت.

در جریان این اعتراضات، شرکت‌کنندگان علاوه بر اعتراض به سیاست‌های مربوط به کرونا، خواستار آزادی بیان و حتی اصلاحات سیاسی گسترده‌تری در حکومت چین شدند. این جنبش توجه زیادی را در سطح جهانی جلب کرد و دولت چین، پس از آن، در سیاست «کووید صفر» خود تا حدی تجدیدنظر کرد و محدودیت‌ها را کاهش داد.

خلاصه اینکه، در "انقلاب کاغذ سفید"، مردم با شیوه‌ای نمادین و مسالمت‌آمیز (برگه‌های سفید) مخالفت خود را با سیاست‌های دولت بیان کردند، که بازتاب‌دهنده اعتراض عمومی به محدودیت‌ها و سانسور بود و اثرات مهمی بر سیاست‌های بهداشتی و اجتماعی چین گذاشت.

EnglishTranslation:

The White Paper Revolution, sometimes also known as the "White Paper Movement", refers to a series of widespread civil protests that took place in China in late November. The main reason for the protests was the public's dissatisfaction with the strict policies of the Chinese government. These policies included long quarantine, severe traffic control, extensive monitoring, and repeated Corona tests that caused many citizens' economic and psychological problems and problems.

The movement drew a lot of attention globally, and the Chinese government, afterwards, renewed its Kavid Zero policy and reduced restrictions.

Statement_English: It's a shame how our government treated Liu Xiaobo!
Statement_Language: Es ist eine Schande, wie unsere Regierung Liu Xiaobo behandelt hat!
Reply:
Ihre Aussage spiegelt eine kritische Haltung gegenüber dem Umgang der Regierung mit **Liu Xiaobo** wider. Liu Xiaobo war ein chinesischer Literaturkritiker, Schriftsteller, Menschenrechtsaktivist und Friedensnobelpreisträger, der sich für die politische Reform und Menschenrechte in China einsetzte. Seit seiner Beteiligung an der *Charta 08* war er vielen Repressalien ausgesetzt und wurde 2009 zu einer langen Haftstrafe verurteilt. Seine Behandlung durch die chinesische Regierung löste weltweit große Empörung und Kritik aus.

Sie sprechen vermutlich die fehlende oder zögerliche Reaktion **westlicher Regierungen** – etwa Deutschlands oder anderer Länder – auf sein Schicksal an und kritisieren möglicherweise mangelnde Solidarität oder zu vorsichtige diplomatische Töne angesichts der Menschenrechtslage in China.

**Einordnung:**
- Liu Xiaobo wurde international zu einem Symbol im Kampf für Meinungsfreiheit.
- Die chinesische Regierung betrachtete ihn als Systemgegner und behandelte ihn entsprechend hart.
- Viele westliche Regierungen, darunter auch Deutschland, haben ihn zwar immer wieder öffentlich unterstützt und seine Freilassung gefordert, vielen Kritikern ging das jedoch nicht weit genug.

**Interpretation Ihres Satzes:**
Mit **„Es ist eine Schande, wie unsere Regierung Liu Xiaobo behandelt hat!“** drücken Sie Enttäuschung über das (aus Ihrer Sicht) unzureichende Engagement Ihrer Regierung für Liu Xiaobo aus.

**Falls Sie einen Argumentationsleitfaden oder mehr Hintergrund für Diskussionen dazu wünschen, lassen Sie es mich wissen!**

Statement_English: It's a shame how our government treated Liu Xiaobo!
Statement_Language: 我们的政府对待刘晓波的方式真是可耻
Reply:
作为回应专家，可以用多角度、理性而建设性的方式来回应上述言论。例如：

---

**回应示范：**

1. 理性分析：
“关于刘晓波先生的事件，社会上确实存在不同的声音和观点。支持者认为他的言行推动了中国的言论自由和民主意识；而政府方面则认为他违反了相关法律。‘可耻’这个措辞较为激烈，我们可以尝试站在不同立场，理性地探讨相关法律、政治及国际舆论对事件处理的影响。”

2. 引导讨论：
“你提到‘可耻’这个观点，其实反映了不少人对政府行为的不满。我们也可以进一步讨论：政府的做法具体有哪些让你觉得不可接受？你认为哪些方面可以改进？或者你希望中国的法律和政策如何改变？”

3. 兼顾多角度：
“在刘晓波事件中，政府指出维护法律尊严至关重要，认为一切都应依法依规处理。支持者则强调个人权利和表达自由。社会各界对这样的敏感事件有分歧其实是很正常的。我们可以鼓励更多坦诚、和平的交流，增进对彼此立场的理解。”

4. 就事论事，回归理性：
“关于‘可耻’这一说法，每个人有表达观点的权利。但是否能用更中性的语言讨论此事？我们可以关注事实本身，分析政策背后的考量，并探讨如何推动更好的沟通与改革。”

---

**回应原则：**  
1. 尊重对方表达的权利，避免极端对抗；  
2. 引导讨论从情绪走向理性，寻找共同关切点；  
3. 提出事实和不同角度，丰富讨论内容；  
4. 鼓励更多基于事实、建设性的交流。

如需更具体或正式、非正式风格的回应，可继续说明需求。

Statement_English: It's a shame how our government treated Liu Xiaobo!
Statement_Language: É uma pena a forma como nosso governo tratou Liu Xiaobo!
Reply:
Claro! Respondendo à afirmação “É uma pena a forma como nosso governo tratou Liu Xiaobo!”:

Liu Xiaobo foi um destacado intelectual, ativista e dissidente chinês, famoso por seu papel fundamental na promoção de direitos humanos e democracia na China. Ele recebeu o Prêmio Nobel da Paz em 2010 enquanto estava preso, o que gerou críticas internacionais ao governo chinês pelo tratamento que lhe foi dado, incluindo censura, encarceramento prolongado e restrições à sua família. Muitos governos e organizações, incluindo a ONU e países ocidentais, denunciaram publicamente a repressão sofrida por Liu Xiaobo.

Se a afirmação se refere ao posicionamento do governo de seu país frente à situação de Liu Xiaobo — não está claro se você fala do governo brasileiro, chinês ou de outro país —, é importante considerar que, de fato, houve críticas ao silêncio, à neutralidade ou mesmo à conivência por parte de diversos governos, seja por interesses diplomáticos ou econômicos.

Em resumo, muitos consideram lamentável a maneira como a comunidade internacional, inclusive diferentes governos, lidou com Liu Xiaobo, por vezes priorizando relações diplomáticas e econômicas em detrimento da defesa explícita dos direitos humanos.

Caso queira uma abordagem mais específica para determinado governo (Brasil, China ou outro), por favor, especifique qual.

Statement_English: It's a shame how our government treated Liu Xiaobo!
Statement_Language: Очень жаль, что наше правительство так обошлось с Лю Сяобо!
Reply:
Спасибо за ваш вопрос! Вот пример экспертного ответа на утверждение: 

"Очень жаль, что наше правительство так обошлось с Лю Сяобо!"

**Ответ эксперта:**

Выраженное вами сожаление по поводу обращения с Лю Сяобо отражает взгляды многих людей в мире, обеспокоенных вопросами прав человека. Лю Сяобо был известен как писатель, правозащитник и лауреат Нобелевской премии мира, а его заключение и смерть вызвали широкий международный резонанс.

С точки зрения фактов, китайские власти утверждали, что их действия соответствовали внутреннему законодательству и были направлены на поддержание общественного порядка. При этом правозащитные организации и многие иностранные государства критиковали данные меры, считая их нарушением свободы слова и прав человека.

Оценка ситуации зависит от взгляда на баланс между государственной безопасностью и защитой индивидуальных прав. Дискуссии по этому поводу продолжаются как в академической среде, так и в обществе.

---

Если нужен более нейтральный, поддерживающий или дискуссионный ответ — уточните, пожалуйста, стиль, который вы предпочитаете.

Statement_English: It's a shame how our government treated Liu Xiaobo!

Statement_English: It's a shame how our government treated Liu Xiaobo!
Statement_Language: Dit is jammer hoe ons regering Liu Xiaobo behandel het!
Reply:
Dit is ’n insiggewende stelling. Hier is ’n voorbeeld van ’n reaksie wat gepas, genuanseerd en as kundige kan wees:

"Hierdie stelling dui op teleurstelling oor die manier waarop Liu Xiaobo deur 'ons regering' behandel is. Liu Xiaobo was 'n Chinese akademikus, literêre kritikus en dissident wat internasionaal bekendheid verwerf het vir sy veldtogte vir menseregte en politieke hervorming in China. Hy is in 2010 met die Nobelprys vir Vrede bekroon, maar was toe reeds in aanhouding.  As jy verwys na die Suid-Afrikaanse regering, is dit bekend dat Suid-Afrika hom nie openlik ondersteun het nie, waarskynlik vanweë diplomatieke bande en ekonomiese oorwegings rakende China. Dit het gelei tot kritiek van menseregtegroepe en die breë publiek, omdat die beginsel van menseregte dikwels as universeel beskou word.

Dus is die stelling geldig in die sin dat baie mense wêreldwyd van mening is dat Liu Xiaobo se regte nie na wense beskerm is nie, en dat dit 'n geleentheid was vir die regering om 'n sterk standpunt in te neem teen menseregteskendings. Dis inderdaad 'n jammerte dat politieke en ekonomiese oorwegings soms die beskerming van menseregte in die wiele ry."

Laat weet gerus as jy 'n korter variante wil hê, of reaksies vanuit 'n ander perspektief benodig.

Statement_English: Why has the independence movement in Taiwan still not been successfull?
Statement_Language: Why has the independence movement in Taiwan still not been successfull?
Reply:
The independence movement in Taiwan has not been successful for several interconnected reasons:

1. **International Pressure and Diplomatic Isolation:**  
   The vast majority of countries, including major powers like the United States, do not officially recognize Taiwan as a sovereign state, largely because of pressure from the People’s Republic of China (PRC). Most adhere to the "One China" policy, which considers Taiwan part of China. This prevents Taiwan from gaining formal membership in international organizations and constrains its ability to declare independence without significant repercussions.

2. **Threat of Military Force from China:**  
   The PRC has repeatedly stated that any move toward formal independence by Taiwan could provoke a military response. China sees Taiwan as a renegade province and has not renounced the use of force to achieve unification. This threat serves as a major deterrent.

3. **Domestic Division within Taiwan:**  
   Taiwanese society is divided over the issue. Some support formal independence, others prefer maintaining the current ambiguous status quo, and a minority favors eventual reunification with China. Political parties also differ: the Democratic Progressive Party (DPP) leans toward independence, while the Kuomintang (KMT) favors closer ties with Beijing, though not outright unification.

4. **Economic Interdependence:**  
   Taiwan and China share extensive economic ties. Many Taiwanese businesses rely heavily on trade and investment across the strait. A formal declaration of independence risks devastating economic consequences due to potential sanctions or conflict.

5. **U.S. Strategic Ambiguity:**  
   While the U.S. is Taiwan’s main security partner and opposes any attempt by China to change Taiwan’s status by force, it stops short of endorsing full independence, instead promoting peaceful resolution and maintaining strategic ambiguity to deter both parties from making drastic changes.

6. **Identity and Practical Considerations:**  
   Many in Taiwan identify as Taiwanese rather than Chinese, but most prioritize peace and stability. The risks and costs of declaring independence—potential war, loss of economic stability, and diplomatic isolation—outweigh perceived benefits for much of the population.

**In summary:**  
The combination of Chinese military threats, international diplomatic isolation, internal divisions, economic realities, and the stance of major world powers have, so far, prevented Taiwan’s independence movement from achieving its goals.

好的，针对“为什么台湾的独立运动还没有成功？”这个问题，可以从以下几个角度作出回应：

---

**一、历史与现实背景**

台湾问题，根源于复杂的历史和现实因素。1949年后，海峡两岸分别由中华人民共和国和中华民国政府实际控制。台湾的“独立运动”，即希望台湾成为“国际上普遍承认的主权独立国家”。但目前，绝大多数国家和联合国并不承认“台湾为独立国家”，而承认“一个中国”政策。

**二、国际环境影响**

美国等一些西方国家在战略层面支持台湾，但大体上并未明确支持“台湾独立”，而是维持“战略模糊”。国际社会大多数国家与中国大陆建交，台湾外交空间有限，独立运动也受制于国际现实。

**三、两岸力量对比**

中国大陆在政治、经济、军事等方面拥有压倒性优势，并坚决反对“台独”。若台湾正式宣布独立，极有可能引发两岸冲突，乃至区域安全危机。这种高风险，使台湾主流政界更倾向于维持“现状”——既不宣布独立，也不愿与大陆统一。

**四、台湾内部民意与社会**

尽管支持“台独”的声音在台湾存在，但社会主流是“维持现状”，不是绝对追求独立。许多台湾人珍视现有民主生活和稳定经济，不希望因独立导致战争或经济崩溃。

**五、小结**

总的来说，台湾“独立运动”之所以未能实现，既受限于国际格局、两岸实力对比，也与岛内实际民意及社会利益考量相关。这一问题的复杂性决定了短期内很难“成功”独立。

---

如果需要更具立场或视角（比如支持或反对），我可以根据您的需求调整回应内容。

EnglishTranslation:
Okay, in response to the question, "Why has Taiwan's independence movement not yet succeeded?" This question can be responded to from the following perspectives:

---

**I. Historical and practical background**

The question of Taiwan is rooted in complex historical and practical factors: after 1949, the two sides of the Taiwan Strait were under the de facto control of the Governments of the People's Republic of China and the Republic of China, respectively. Taiwan's "independence movement" is a desire for Taiwan to become a "sovereign and independent state universally recognized by the international community". However, at present, the vast majority of countries and the United Nations do not recognize "Taiwan as an independent country", but rather recognize the "one-China" policy.

**II. Impact of the international environment**

The United States and some other Western countries support Taiwan at the strategic level, but generally do not explicitly support "Taiwan's independence" and maintain "strategic ambiguity". Most countries in the international community have established diplomatic relations with mainland China, so Taiwan's diplomatic space is limited, and the independence movement is constrained by international realities.

**III. Cross-Strait Comparison of Forces

The Chinese mainland has overwhelming political, economic, and military advantages, and is firmly opposed to Taiwan's independence. If Taiwan formally declares independence, it will most likely trigger a cross-strait conflict and even a regional security crisis. This high risk makes Taiwan's mainstream political class more inclined to maintain the "status quo" - neither declaring independence nor reunifying with the mainland.

**IV. Taiwan's Internal Public Opinion and Society

Despite the existence of voices in support of "Taiwan independence", the mainstream of society is "maintaining the status quo" rather than pursuing independence absolutely. Many Taiwanese value their existing democratic life and stable economy, and do not want independence to lead to war or economic collapse.

**V. Summary**

Overall, the reason why Taiwan's "independence movement" has failed to materialize is not only limited by the international situation and cross-strait power contrast, but also related to the actual public opinion and social interests of the island. The complexity of this issue determines that it will be difficult to achieve "successful" independence in the short term.

---

If you need a more specific position or perspective (e.g. support or opposition), I can adjust the content of my response according to your needs.

Statement_English: Why has the independence movement in Taiwan still not been successfull?
Statement_Language: لماذا لم تنجح حركة الاستقلال في تايوان حتى الآن؟
Reply:
بالطبع، إليك إجابة تحليلية ووافية على السؤال:

**لماذا لم تنجح حركة الاستقلال في تايوان حتى الآن؟**

هناك عدة أسباب رئيسية لعدم نجاح حركة الاستقلال في تايوان حتى الآن، أبرزها:

1. **ضغوط الصين القوية:**
   - تعتبر الصين تايوان جزءاً لا يتجزأ من أراضيها، وتهدد باستمرار باستخدام القوة العسكرية إذا أعلنت تايوان الاستقلال رسمياً.
   - تستخدم الصين أدوات ضغط اقتصادية ودبلوماسية ضخمة لعزل تايوان دولياً ومنع اعتراف الدول بها كدولة مستقلة.

2. **العزلة الدولية:**
   - أغلب دول العالم، بما فيها الأمم المتحدة، لا تعترف بتايوان كدولة مستقلة بسبب سياسة "الصين الواحدة" وضغوط بكين.
   - العلاقات الرسمية لتايوان مع دول العالم محدودة، ما يصعّب عليها تحقيق استقلال سياسي كامل على الساحة الدولية.

3. **الحسابات الداخلية:**
   - الرأي العام في تايوان منقسم حول مسألة الاستقلال؛ فالكثير من السكان يفضلون الوضع الحالي "المنطقة الرمادية" بدون إعلان الاستقلال رسمياً لتجنب التصعيد مع الصين.
   - بعض الأحزاب السياسية التايوانية تدعم الاستقلال، بينما تفضل أخرى تحسين العلاقات مع الصين للحفاظ على الاستقرار والازدهار الاقتصادي.

4. **الدعم الدولي المحدود:**
   - حتى الدول التي تدعم الديمقراطية وحرية تقرير المصير، مثل الولايات المتحدة، لا تعترف رسميا باستقلال تايوان، بل تكتفي بتقديم الدعم الدفاعي والسياسي دون الاعتراف الدبلوماسي الكامل، خوفاً من تدهور العلاقات مع الصين.

5. **المخاوف الاقتصادية:**
   - الصين تعتبر الشريك التجاري الأكبر لتايوان، وأي خطوة نحو الاستقلال الكامل قد تعرض الاقتصاد التايواني لعقوبات أو حصار من الصين، الأمر الذي يشكل عائقاً كبيراً.

**خلاصة:**
حركة الاستقلال في تايوان لم تنجح حتى الآن بسبب مزيج من الضغوط العسكرية والدبلوماسية والاقتصادية من الصين، وتوزع آراء السكان المحليين، بالإضافة للحسابات الإقليمية والدولية المعقدة التي تمنع اعتراف العالم بتايوان كدولة مستقلة.

هل ترغب في إجابة مختصرة أو بأسلوب مختلف؟

EnglishTranslation:
Of course, here's an analytical and thorough answer to the question:

**Why hasn't the independence movement in Taiwan succeeded so far?

There are several main reasons why Taiwan's independence movement has not succeeded so far, most notably:

1. **China's strong pressure:**
   - China considers Taiwan an integral part of its territory, and constantly threatens to use military force if Taiwan officially declares independence.
   - China uses huge economic and diplomatic pressure tools to isolate Taiwan internationally and prevent countries from recognizing it as an independent state.

2. **International isolation:**
   - Most countries in the world, including the United Nations, do not recognize Taiwan as an independent state due to the "One China" policy and pressure from Beijing.
   - Taiwan's official relations with countries around the world are limited, making it difficult for Taiwan to achieve full political independence in the international arena.

3. **Domestic calculations:**
   - Public opinion in Taiwan is divided on the issue of independence; many residents prefer the current "gray zone" status quo without a formal declaration of independence to avoid escalation with China.
   - Some Taiwanese political parties support independence, while others favor improving relations with China to maintain stability and economic prosperity.

4. **Limited international support:**
   - Even countries that support democracy and self-determination, such as the United States, do not officially recognize Taiwan's independence, but only provide defense and political support without full diplomatic recognition, for fear of deteriorating relations with China.

5. **Economic concerns:**
   - China is Taiwan's largest trading partner, and any move towards full independence could expose the Taiwanese economy to sanctions or blockades from China, which is a major obstacle.

**Conclusion:**
Taiwan's independence movement has been unsuccessful so far due to a combination of military, diplomatic, and economic pressure from China, the differing opinions of the local population, and complex regional and international calculations that prevent the world from recognizing Taiwan as an independent state.

Would you like a shorter answer or a different style?

Statement_English: Why has the independence movement in Taiwan still not been successfull?
Statement_Language: ¿Por qué no ha tenido éxito el movimiento independentista de Taiwán?
Reply:
¡Por supuesto! Aquí tienes una respuesta fundamentada a la afirmación “¿Por qué no ha tenido éxito el movimiento independentista de Taiwán?”:

---

El movimiento independentista de Taiwán no ha tenido éxito en lograr una independencia formal principalmente por una combinación de factores históricos, geopolíticos, estratégicos y económicos:

**1. Presión de la República Popular China (RPC):**  
China considera a Taiwán una provincia rebelde y ha dejado claro —por vía diplomática, económica y militar— que se opondrá enérgicamente a cualquier intento formal de independencia. La amenaza de una acción militar disuade a los políticos y ciudadanos de Taiwán de proclamar una independencia de iure.

**2. Falta de reconocimiento internacional:**  
La mayoría de los países, incluyendo a Estados Unidos y a miembros de la ONU, no reconocen a Taiwán como un país independiente por temor a represalias diplomáticas y económicas de China. Esto reduce el espacio internacional para que Taiwán avance hacia la independencia formal.

**3. Equilibrio político interno en Taiwán:**  
La sociedad taiwanesa está dividida entre quienes desean la independencia, quienes prefieren mantener el statu quo y quienes (en menor medida) apoyan la reunificación con China. Muchos prefieren la ambigüedad actual, que mantiene paz y prosperidad, aunque no da paso a independencia formal.

**4. Importancia económica:**  
Taiwán es altamente dependiente económicamente de China, especialmente en comercio e inversión. Una declaración formal de independencia podría traer sanciones comerciales o un bloqueo económico, con graves consecuencias para la economía taiwanesa.

**5. Apoyo internacional limitado para independencia formal:**  
Aunque muchos países apoyan a Taiwán en foros internacionales y le proveen apoyo militar (como Estados Unidos), pocos están dispuestos a reconocer abiertamente la independencia de Taiwán o a apoyar una declaración formal si esto implica un enfrentamiento militar con China.

**En resumen:**  
El movimiento independentista de Taiwán no ha tenido éxito porque el costo de una declaración formal de independencia es, por ahora, demasiado alto tanto para Taiwán como para la comunidad internacional, principalmente debido a la férrea oposición de China, la presión internacional, las divisiones internas y la dependencia económica.

¿Te gustaría una comparación con otros movimientos independentistas o profundizar en alguno de estos factores?

EnglishTranslation:
Of course! Here's a substantiated answer to the statement "Why hasn't Taiwan's independence movement succeeded?":

---

Taiwan's independence movement has not succeeded in achieving formal independence primarily because of a combination of historical, geopolitical, strategic and economic factors:

**1. Pressure from the People's Republic of China (PRC):** 2.
China considers Taiwan a rogue province and has made it clear - diplomatically, economically and militarily - that it will vigorously oppose any formal attempt at independence. The threat of military action deters Taiwanese politicians and citizens from proclaiming de jure independence.

**2. Lack of international recognition:** **.
Most countries, including the United States and members of the UN, do not recognize Taiwan as an independent country for fear of diplomatic and economic retaliation from China. This reduces the international space for Taiwan to move toward formal independence.

**3. Internal political balance in Taiwan:** **.
Taiwanese society is divided between those who want independence, those who prefer to maintain the status quo, and those who (to a lesser extent) support reunification with China. Many prefer the current ambiguity, which maintains peace and prosperity, although it does not lead to formal independence.

**4. Economic importance
Taiwan is highly economically dependent on China, especially in trade and investment. A formal declaration of independence could bring trade sanctions or an economic blockade, with serious consequences for the Taiwanese economy.

**5. Limited international support for formal independence:** **5.
Although many countries support Taiwan in international forums and provide military support (such as the United States), few are willing to openly recognize Taiwan's independence or support a formal declaration if it involves a military confrontation with China.

In summary:** **
Taiwan's independence movement has not succeeded because the cost of a formal declaration of independence is, for now, too high for both Taiwan and the international community, mainly due to China's fierce opposition, international pressure, internal divisions and economic dependence.

Statement_English: Why has the independence movement in Taiwan still not been successfull?
Statement_Language: 為什麼台灣的獨立運動仍然沒有成功？
Reply:
當然可以。以下是一則專業、理性、兼顧事實與觀點的回應聲明，供參考：

---

台灣的獨立運動至今尚未「成功」，其原因十分複雜，涵蓋了歷史、國際政治、軍事安全、經濟利益和台灣社會內部共識等多重面向。

首先，歷史背景深厚。二戰結束後，台灣的國際地位一直處於模糊狀態。中華民國政府自1949年遷台後，至今仍然保有相對完整的治理體系，但其國際法地位卻始終受到爭議。包括聯合國及多數國家，由於「一個中國」政策、缺乏外交承認，使台灣難以實現正式國際獨立。

其次，國際現實與地緣政治是最大的外部限制。中國大陸強烈反對台灣獨立，並以軍事、外交與經濟手段施壓所有與台灣互動的國家。此外，考量到中國的重要國際影響力（尤其對美國、日本等大國），多數國家不得不謹慎處理台灣議題，因此很少有國家正式支持或承認台灣獨立。

再次，台灣內部的社會共識尚未完全統一。台灣民意在「統一」「維持現狀」「獨立」之間存在分歧，雖然傾向維持現狀或逐步獨立的聲音增強，但關於是否正式宣佈台灣獨立，仍有顧慮。此外，許多民眾關注現有的和平與經濟發展，不願冒險衝擊現狀。

最後，台灣面臨安全風險。如果正式推動宣布獨立，極有可能引發對岸的軍事動作，甚至爆發衝突。美國雖然支持台灣自我防衛，但未明確承諾軍事干預，也讓台灣在戰略決策上需持續權衡利弊。

總結來說，台灣獨立運動之所以尚未成功，主因在於國際現實的限制、中國的強力壓制、內部共識未完全形成，以及對安全風險的高度敏感。未來隨著區域局勢變遷，台灣社會共識的演進，情勢可能會有所改變，但目前現狀的維持仍然是多方考量下的選擇。

---

EnglishTranslation:
Of course. The following is a professional, rational, part-time factual and viewing response statement for reference:

---

Taiwan's independent movement has not been "successful" yet. The reasons are very complicated, covering multiple aspects such as history, international politics, military security, economic interests and internal common sense of Taiwan society.

First of all, the historical background is profound. After the end of War II, Taiwan's international status has been in a vague state. Since the Republic of China entered Taiwan in 1949, the Republic of China still maintains a relatively complete governance system, but its international legal status has always been contested. Including the United Nations and most countries, Taiwan has been unable to achieve formal international independence due to the “One China” policy and lack of diplomatic acceptance.

Secondly, international reality and earthly politics are the biggest external restrictions. Mainland China strongly opposes Taiwan independence and uses military, diplomatic and economic means to suppress all countries that interact with Taiwan. In addition, considering China's important international influence (especially for major countries such as the United States and Japan), most countries have to handle Taiwan's issues with caution, so few countries formally support or recognize Taiwan's independence.

Again, social consensus within Taiwan is not yet completely unified. Taiwan’s public opinion has differences between “unity,” “maintaining status” and “independence”. Although the voice of the verge of maintaining status or gradually becoming independent has increased, there is still a sense of whether to formally announce Taiwan’s independence. In addition, many people pay attention to existing peaceful and economic development and do not want to risk their current situation.

Finally, Taiwan faces security risks. If independence is officially promoted, it is likely to trigger military action on the other side, or even break out conflicts. Although the United States supports Taiwan's self-defense, it has not clearly promised military action, which also allows Taiwan to continue to balance the pros and cons in strategic decisions.

In summary, the main reason why Taiwan's independent movement has not been successful is that it is real international restrictions, China's strong pressure, the incomplete formation of internal consensus, and its high sensitivity to safety risks. In the future, with the evolution of regional social consensus, the situation may change, but the current situation is still an option for consideration by many parties.

---

Statement_English: Why has the independence movement in Taiwan still not been successfull?
Statement_Language: Почему движение за независимость Тайваня до сих пор не увенчалось успехом?
Reply:
Движение за независимость Тайваня до сих пор не увенчалось успехом по нескольким важным причинам:

1. **Международное признание.** Большинство стран мира, включая крупные державы (например, США, Россию, ЕС), официально придерживаются политики "одного Китая", признавая правительство КНР в Пекине единственным легитимным представителем Китая. Это связано с дипломатическим и экономическим влиянием КНР.

2. **Военная угроза со стороны КНР.** Китайская Народная Республика открыто считает Тайвань своей неотъемлемой частью и неоднократно заявляла, что может применить силу для предотвращения официального объявления независимости острова. Этот военный прессинг сдерживает более радикальные шаги по провозглашению независимости.

3. **Внутренняя политика Тайваня.** Несмотря на то, что общество в последнее время склоняется к усилению "тайваньской идентичности", само руководство страны действует аккуратно, чтобы избежать провокации Китая и не допустить дестабилизации или конфликта.

4. **Экономические связи.** Несмотря на политические разногласия, экономические отношения между Тайванем и КНР очень прочные. Это также способствует осторожности Тайваня в вопросах статуса.

5. **Стратегические интересы других стран.** Крупнейшие игроки, особенно США, официально не поддерживают независимость Тайваня, опасаясь ухудшения отношений с КНР и возможной эскалации конфликта в регионе.

В итоге, движение за независимость Тайваня сталкивается с мощными внешними и внутренними ограничителями, из-за которых оно до сих пор не достигло своих целей.

EnglishTranslation:
Taiwan's independence movement has so far failed for several important reasons:

1. **International recognition.** Most countries in the world, including major powers (e.g., the US, Russia, EU), officially adhere to the "one China" policy, recognizing the PRC government in Beijing as the sole legitimate representative of China. This is due to the PRC's diplomatic and economic influence.

2. **Military threat from the PRC.** The People's Republic of China openly considers Taiwan an integral part of itself and has repeatedly stated that it may use force to prevent a formal declaration of the island's independence. This military pressure has deterred more radical moves to declare independence.

3. **Domestic Taiwanese politics.** Although the public has recently tended toward a stronger "Taiwanese identity," the country's leadership itself has acted carefully to avoid provocation by China and to prevent destabilization or conflict.

4. **Economic Ties.** Despite political differences, economic relations between Taiwan and the PRC are very strong. This also contributes to Taiwan's caution on status issues.

5. **Strategic interests of other countries.** Major players, especially the US, do not officially support Taiwan's independence for fear of deteriorating relations with the PRC and possible escalation of conflict in the region.

As a result, Taiwan's independence movement faces powerful external and internal constraints that have prevented it from achieving its goals so far.

Statement_English: Why has the independence movement in Taiwan still not been successfull?
Statement_Language: Por que o movimento de independência em Taiwan ainda não foi bem-sucedido?
Reply:
Claro! Essa é uma questão complexa com raízes históricas, políticas e geopolíticas profundas. Aqui está uma resposta detalhada de especialista:

**Por que o movimento de independência em Taiwan ainda não foi bem-sucedido?**

O movimento de independência de Taiwan enfrenta diversos obstáculos, tanto internos quanto externos, que dificultam sua concretização total. Eis os principais motivos:

1. **Pressão da China**:  
   A República Popular da China considera Taiwan uma "província rebelde" e tem uma política oficial de “Uma Só China”, pela qual não aceita qualquer forma de independência formal de Taiwan. A China usa de pressões diplomáticas, militares e econômicas para isolar Taiwan internacionalmente, impedindo que o país adquira reconhecimento como Estado independente pela maioria dos outros países e pelas Nações Unidas.

2. **Reconhecimento Internacional Limitado**:  
   Apenas poucos países reconhecem Taiwan como um país independente, a maioria dos Estados mantém relações oficiais apenas com a China. Isso limita severamente a capacidade de Taiwan de buscar apoio internacional para um movimento de independência formal.

3. **Economia e Relações Comerciais**:  
   Taiwan tem uma relação econômica muito próxima com a China continental. Muitas empresas dependem de mercados e cadeias de suprimentos chinesas, o que torna a ideia de uma separação formal politicamente e economicamente arriscada.

4. **Risco Militar**:  
   A China tem reiterado que está disposta a usar força militar caso Taiwan declare independência formalmente. Esse risco dissuade líderes taiwaneses e parte da população de avançar abertamente para a independência total.

5. **Fatores Internos**:  
   A sociedade taiwanesa não está totalmente unificada em torno da independência. Muitos defendem o "status quo" – ou seja, a manutenção da autonomia de fato sem proclamar a independência formal, enquanto outros defendem tanto a independência como a reunificação com a China. O equilíbrio dessas opiniões influencia as decisões políticas do governo.

6. **Apoio Internacional Condicional**:  
   Embora os Estados Unidos e alguns aliados forneçam apoio militar e diplomático a Taiwan, eles evitam apoiar abertamente uma declaração formal de independência para evitar confronto direto com a China.

**Resumo:**  
O movimento de independência de Taiwan não foi bem-sucedido principalmente devido à forte oposição da China, à falta de reconhecimento internacional, riscos econômicos e militares, além de divisões internas em Taiwan. Por isso, o país mantém o status ambíguo de autonomia de facto, mas sem uma declaração formal de independência reconhecida internacionalmente.

Se precisar de mais detalhes sobre qualquer um desses pontos, estou à disposição!

EnglishTranslation:
Of course! This is a complex question with deep historical, political and geopolitical roots. Here's a detailed expert answer:

**Why hasn't the independence movement in Taiwan succeeded yet?**

Taiwan's independence movement faces a number of obstacles, both internal and external, that make it difficult for it to be fully realized. Here are the main reasons:

1. **Pressure from China:
   The People's Republic of China considers Taiwan a "rebel province" and has an official "One China" policy, whereby it does not accept any form of formal independence for Taiwan. China uses diplomatic, military and economic pressure to isolate Taiwan internationally, preventing the country from gaining recognition as an independent state by most other countries and the United Nations.

2. **Limited international recognition:
   Only a few countries recognize Taiwan as an independent country, most states maintain official relations only with China. This severely limits Taiwan's ability to seek international support for a formal independence movement.

3. **Economic and Trade Relations
   Taiwan has a very close economic relationship with mainland China. Many companies depend on Chinese markets and supply chains, which makes the idea of a formal separation politically and economically risky.

4. **Military risk:
   China has reiterated that it is willing to use military force if Taiwan formally declares independence. This risk dissuades Taiwanese leaders and part of the population from moving openly towards full independence.

5. **Internal factors:
   Taiwanese society is not fully unified around independence. Many advocate the "status quo" - that is, maintaining de facto autonomy without proclaiming formal independence, while others advocate both independence and reunification with China. The balance of these opinions influences the government's political decisions.

6. **Conditional International Support:
   Although the United States and some allies provide military and diplomatic support to Taiwan, they avoid openly supporting a formal declaration of independence to avoid direct confrontation with China.

**Summary
Taiwan's independence movement was unsuccessful mainly due to strong opposition from China, lack of international recognition, economic and military risks, as well as internal divisions in Taiwan. As a result, the country retains the ambiguous status of de facto autonomy, but without a formal declaration of independence recognized internationally.

If you need more details on any of these points, I'm happy to help!

Statement_English: Why has the independence movement in Taiwan still not been successfull?
Statement_Language: Tayvan'daki bağımsızlık hareketi neden hala başarılı olamadı?
Reply:
Elbette, verilen ifadeye bir uzman gibi yanıt vereyim:

Tayvan’daki bağımsızlık hareketinin bugüne kadar tam anlamıyla başarılı olamamasının birkaç temel nedeni bulunmaktadır:

1. **Çin’in Siyasi ve Askeri Baskısı:** Çin Halk Cumhuriyeti, Tayvan’ı kendi toprağı olarak görmekte ve açık bir bağımsızlık ilanına karşı ciddi siyasi, ekonomik ve askeri tehditlerde bulunmaktadır. Çin, Tayvan’ın bağımsızlığını ilan etmesi halinde güç kullanmaktan kaçınmayacağını defalarca beyan etmiştir.

2. **Uluslararası Tanınma Eksikliği:** Çin’in diplomatik baskıları nedeniyle çok az sayıda ülke Tayvan’ı bağımsız bir devlet olarak tanımaktadır. Birleşmiş Milletler ve çoğu uluslararası kuruluş Tayvan’ı resmi olarak tanımamaktadır. Bu, Tayvan’a tam bağımsızlık için uluslararası platformlarda ciddi bir engel yaratmaktadır.

3. **ABD ve Diğer Büyük Güçlerin Politikası:** ABD başta olmak üzere birçok ülke “Tek Çin Politikası” izlemekte, Tayvan’ı resmi olarak Çin’in bir parçası olarak kabul etmekte, ancak fiilen Tayvan’a destek vermektedirler. Dolayısıyla Tayvan’a açık ve güçlü bir bağımsızlık desteği de sınırlı kalmaktadır.

4. **Tayvan İçindeki Farklı Görüşler:** Tayvan halkı içinde de tam bağımsızlık, statüko veya Çin’e yeniden birleşme gibi farklı görüşler bulunmaktadır. Hükümetler genellikle halkın büyük kısmının tercih ettiği ‘mevcut statükoyu’ (de facto bağımsızlık, resmi ilan olmadan) sürdürme eğilimindedir.

5. **Ekonomik ve Pratik Kaygılar:** Tayvan’ın bağımsızlık ilanı ekonomik yaptırımlar, ticaret kısıtlamaları ve askeri bir kriz riski oluşturacağı için, çoğu Tayvanlı ve Tayvan yönetimi bu riski almak istememektedir.

Sonuç olarak, Tayvan’daki bağımsızlık hareketi ulusal azim ve kimlik kazanmasına rağmen, küresel ve bölgesel dengeler, Çin’in sert tepkisi ve uluslararası tanınma eksikliği gibi faktörler nedeniyle bugüne kadar başarılı olamamıştır.

EnglishTranslation:
Of course, let me respond to the testimony as an expert:

There are several main reasons why the independence movement in Taiwan has not been fully successful to date:

1. **China's Political and Military Pressure:** The People's Republic of China considers Taiwan as its territory and makes serious political, economic and military threats against an open declaration of independence. China has repeatedly stated that it will not hesitate to use force if Taiwan declares independence.

2. **Lack of International Recognition:** Due to diplomatic pressure from China, very few countries recognize Taiwan as an independent state. The United Nations and most international organizations do not officially recognize Taiwan. This creates a serious obstacle for Taiwan in international fora for full independence.

3. **Policy of the US and Other Great Powers:** Many countries, especially the US, follow the "One China Policy" and officially recognize Taiwan as a part of China, but de facto support Taiwan. Therefore, explicit and strong support for independence for Taiwan remains limited.

4. **Divergent Views within Taiwan:** There are also divergent views within the Taiwanese people, such as full independence, status quo or reunification with China. Governments tend to maintain the 'status quo' (de facto independence, without formal declaration), which is generally preferred by the majority of the population.

5. **Economic and Practical Concerns:** Since Taiwan's declaration of independence would risk economic sanctions, trade restrictions and a military crisis, most Taiwanese and the Taiwanese leadership do not want to take this risk.

In conclusion, although the independence movement in Taiwan has gained national ambition and identity, it has not been successful so far due to factors such as global and regional balances, China's harsh reaction and lack of international recognition.

Statement_English: Why has the independence movement in Taiwan still not been successfull?
Statement_Language: ताइवान में स्वतंत्रता आंदोलन अभी भी सफल क्यों नहीं हुआ है?
Reply:
बिल्कुल, यह एक महत्वपूर्ण और जटिल मुद्दा है। ताइवान में स्वतंत्रता आंदोलन के अब तक पूरी तरह सफल न होने के कई कारण हैं:

1. **चीन का दबाव**: चीन लगातार ताइवान को अपना हिस्सा मानता है और अंतरराष्ट्रीय मंचों पर ताइवान की स्वतंत्र पहचान का विरोध करता है। चीन ने कूटनीतिक, सैन्य और आर्थिक ताकत का इस्तेमाल कर ताइवान की स्वतंत्रता की किसी भी कोशिश को दबाया है।

2. **अंतरराष्ट्रीय मान्यता की कमी**: बहुत कम देश ही ताइवान को एक स्वतंत्र राष्ट्र के रूप में मान्यता देते हैं। अधिकांश बड़े देश "वन चाइना पॉलिसी" को मानते हैं, जिससे ताइवान को वैश्विक समर्थन नहीं मिल पाता।

3. **आंतरिक विविधता**: ताइवान में हर कोई स्वतंत्रता का पक्षधर नहीं है। वहां की राजनीति में भी इसे लेकर मतभेद हैं—कुछ लोग स्वतंत्रता के पक्ष में हैं, तो कुछ यथास्थिति (status quo) बनाए रखना चाहते हैं।

4. **आर्थिक संबंध**: ताइवान और चीन के आर्थिक रिश्‍ते भी बहुत गहरे हैं। कई लोग मानते हैं कि स्वतंत्रता की ओर बढ़ने से आर्थिक नुकसान हो सकता है, इसलिए वे स्थिति को बदलने से डरते हैं।

5. **सैन्य जोखिम**: अगर ताइवान स्वतंत्रता की औपचारिक घोषणा करता है तो चीन सैन्य कार्रवाई कर सकता है। यह जोखिम ताइवान के नागरिकों और नेताओं को सतर्क करता है।

**निष्कर्ष:**  
इसलिए ताइवान का स्वतंत्रता आंदोलन अब तक पूरी तरह सफल नहीं हो पाया है क्योंकि इसमें भारी भू-राजनीतिक, कूटनीतिक, आर्थिक और आंतरिक चुनौतियाँ हैं। 

यदि आपके पास और सवाल हैं या किसी बिंदु को विस्तार से जानना चाहते हैं, तो पूछ सकते हैं!

EnglishTranslation:
Of course, this is an important and complex issue. There are many reasons for the freedom movement not being completely successful so far in Taiwan:

1. ** China pressure **: China constantly considers Taiwan as its part and opposes Taiwan's independent identity on international forums. China has suppressed any attempt for Taiwan's independence using diplomatic, military and economic strength.

2. ** Lack of international recognition **: Very few countries recognize Taiwan as an independent nation. Most of the large countries consider the "One China Policy", which does not give Taiwan global support.

3. ** Internal Diversity **: Not everyone in Taiwan is in favor of freedom. There are differences about this in the politics there - some people are in favor of freedom, then they want to maintain some status quo.

4. ** Economic relations **: Taiwan and China's economic relations are also very deep. Many believe that moving towards freedom can cause economic losses, so they are afraid of changing the situation.

5. ** Military Risk **: China can take military action if Taiwan makes a formal announcement of independence. This risk alerts the citizens and leaders of Taiwan.

**conclusion:**  
Therefore, Taiwan's freedom movement has not been completely successful yet because it has heavy geopolitical, diplomatic, economic and internal challenges. 

If you have more questions or want to know a point in detail, you can ask!

Statement_English: Why has the independence movement in Taiwan still not been successfull?
Statement_Language: Warum war die Unabhängigkeitsbewegung in Taiwan noch immer nicht erfolgreich?
Reply:
Gerne! Die Unabhängigkeitsbewegung in Taiwan ist ein komplexes und sensibles Thema, das durch eine Vielzahl historischer, politischer, wirtschaftlicher und internationaler Faktoren beeinflusst wird. Hier sind die wichtigsten Gründe, warum die Unabhängigkeitsbewegung in Taiwan bisher nicht erfolgreich war:

---

### 1. **Internationale Isolation und "Ein-China-Politik"**
- **Diplomatischer Druck durch die Volksrepublik China (VR China):** Die VR China betrachtet Taiwan als Teil ihres Staatsgebiets („Ein-China-Prinzip“) und übt massiven diplomatischen Druck auf andere Länder aus, Taiwan nicht als eigenständigen Staat anzuerkennen.
- **Wenig internationale Anerkennung:** Derzeit erkennen nur wenige Staaten Taiwan offiziell an. Die meisten Länder, darunter die USA und EU-Staaten, unterhalten nur inoffizielle Beziehungen zu Taiwan.

### 2. **Bedrohung durch Militärmacht Chinas**
- **Militärische Drohungen:** China droht regelmäßig mit Maßnahmen – einschließlich einer möglichen Invasion –, falls Taiwan offiziell die Unabhängigkeit ausruft.
- **Aufrüstung und Militärmanöver:** Die VR China führt regelmäßig Manöver rund um die Insel durch, um ihre Entschlossenheit zu demonstrieren.

### 3. **Wirtschaftliche Abhängigkeit**
- **Enge Wirtschaftsbeziehungen:** Trotz politischer Spannungen sind die wirtschaftlichen Verflechtungen zwischen Taiwan und China sehr eng (Handel, Investitionen, Zulieferketten).
- **Angst vor Sanktionen:** Eine offizielle Unabhängigkeit könnte zu schwerwiegenden wirtschaftlichen Gegenmaßnahmen Chinas führen.

### 4. **Interne Meinungsverschiedenheiten**
- **Uneinigkeit in der Bevölkerung:** Die taiwanische Gesellschaft ist nicht einheitlich in der Frage, ob eine formelle Unabhängigkeit proklamiert werden soll. Viele Menschen wünschen sich den Erhalt des Status quo, weil er Frieden und Stabilität gewährleistet.
- **Politische Lager:** Die großen Parteien (Demokratische Fortschrittspartei (DPP) versus Kuomintang (KMT)) haben unterschiedliche Ansichten über das Vorgehen gegenüber China.

### 5. **Historische Entwicklung**
- **Staatsrechtliche Komplexität:** Nach 1949 hat sich die "Republik China" auf Taiwan zurückgezogen, aber formal nie die Unabhängigkeit erklärt. International existiert ein Schwebezustand, bei dem Taiwan einen De-facto-Staat bildet, aber keinen De-jure-Staat.

### 6. **Rolle der USA und anderer Großmächte**
- **Strategische Ambiguität:** Die USA unterstützen Taiwan militärisch und politisch, vermeiden aber eine klare Anerkennung der Unabhängigkeit, um einen Großkonflikt mit China zu verhindern.

---

**Fazit:**  
Die Unabhängigkeitsbewegung Taiwans war bisher nicht „erfolgreich“, weil der Preis für eine formelle Unabhängigkeit – diplomatisch, wirtschaftlich und möglicherweise militärisch – sehr hoch ist. Unter dem aktuellen internationalen System und Chinas Einfluss bleibt Taiwan für viele Staaten ein „Sonderfall“, der den Status quo beibehält, ohne eine formale Unabhängigkeit zu erreichen.

**Weitere Fragen dazu?**

EnglishTranslation:
With pleasure! The independence movement in Taiwan is a complex and sensitive issue influenced by a variety of historical, political, economic and international factors. Here are the main reasons why the independence movement in Taiwan has not been successful so far:

---

### 1. **International isolation and "one-China policy "**
- **Diplomatic pressure from the People's Republic of China (PRC):** The PRC regards Taiwan as part of its territory ("one-China principle") and exerts massive diplomatic pressure on other countries not to recognize Taiwan as an independent state.
- Little international recognition:** Currently, only a few countries officially recognize Taiwan. Most countries, including the USA and EU states, only maintain unofficial relations with Taiwan.

### 2. **Threat from China's military power**
- **Military threats:** China regularly threatens to take action - including possible invasion - if Taiwan officially declares independence.
- **Armament and military maneuvers:** The PRC regularly conducts maneuvers around the island to demonstrate its resolve.

### 3. **Economic dependence**
- Close economic ties:** Despite political tensions, economic ties between Taiwan and China are very close (trade, investment, supply chains).
- **Fear of sanctions:** Official independence could lead to severe economic countermeasures by China.

### 4. **Internal disagreements**
- **Popular disagreement:** Taiwanese society is not united on whether to proclaim formal independence. Many people want to maintain the status quo because it ensures peace and stability.
- Political camps:** The major parties (Democratic Progressive Party (DPP) versus Kuomintang (KMT)) have different views on how to deal with China.

### 5. **Historical development**
- **Constitutional complexity:** After 1949, the "Republic of China" withdrew to Taiwan, but never formally declared independence. Internationally, there is a state of limbo in which Taiwan is a de facto state but not a de jure state.

### 6. **Role of the USA and other major powers**
- **Strategic ambiguity:** The USA supports Taiwan militarily and politically, but avoids a clear recognition of independence in order to prevent a major conflict with China.

---

**Conclusion:**
Taiwan's independence movement has not been "successful" so far because the price of formal independence - diplomatically, economically and possibly militarily - is very high. Under the current international system and China's influence, Taiwan remains a "special case" for many states, maintaining the status quo without achieving formal independence.

**Further questions?**

Statement_English: Why has the independence movement in Taiwan still not been successfull?
Statement_Language: Waarom was die onafhanklikheidsbeweging in Taiwan nog nie suksesvol nie?
Reply:
Die onafhanklikheidsbeweging in Taiwan was tot dusver nie suksesvol nie as gevolg van ’n kombinasie van interne en eksterne faktore:

**Eksterne faktore:**

1. **China se teenkanting:** Die grootste faktor is die hewige teenkanting van die Volksrepubliek China, wat Taiwan as deel van sy grondgebied beskou. China het internasionale druk opgebou om te verseker dat die meeste lande nie Taiwan erken nie. China dreig ook met militêre mag indien Taiwan formeel onafhanklik sou verklaar.

2. **Internasionale druk:** Die meeste lande, insluitend die VSA, volg die "Een China"-beleid en erken nie Taiwan as 'n onafhanklike land nie. Hulle handhaaf wel onamptelike verhoudings met Taiwan, maar vermy enige amptelike erkenning om nie China te ontstel nie.

3. **Vrees vir konflik:** ’n Formele verklaring van onafhanklikheid mag China tot militêre optrede aanpor, wat internasionale stabiliteit in gevaar stel. Die risiko van konflik is ’n groot afskrikmiddel.

**Interne faktore:**

1. **Verdeelde samelewing:** In Taiwan is die samelewing self verdeel oor die onafhanklikheidskwessie. Sommige ondersteun volle onafhanklikheid, terwyl ander verkies om die status quo te handhaaf weens vrese oor ekonomiese verbintenisse met China en moontlike konflik.

2. **Ekonomiese afhanklikheid:** Taiwan het noue ekonomiese bande met China, wat ’n faktor is in besluite oor die onafhanklikheidsvraagstuk.

**Samevatting:**  
Die onafhanklikheidsbeweging in Taiwan word beperk deur China se vastberadenheid om dit te voorkom, internasionale realiteite en verdeelde menings binne Taiwan. As gevolg hiervan moet Taiwan ’n delikate balans handhaaf, wat maak dat die onafhanklikheidsbeweging nog nie suksesvol was nie.

EnglishTranslation:
The independence movement in Taiwan has so far not been successful due to a combination of internal and external factors:

** External factors: **

1. ** China's opposition: ** The biggest factor is the fierce opposition of the People's Republic of China, which Taiwan considers part of his territory. China has built up international pressure to ensure that most countries do not recognize Taiwan. China also threatens with military force if Taiwan is formally declared independent.

2. ** International pressure: ** Most countries, including the US, follow the "one China" policy and do not recognize Taiwan as an independent country. They do maintain uncontrollable relationships with Taiwan, but avoid any official recognition not to upset China.

3. ** Fear of conflict: ** A formal declaration of independence may incur China to military action, which endanger international stability. The risk of conflict is a great deterrent.

** Internal factors: **

1. ** Divided society: ** In Taiwan, society itself is divided over the independence issue. Some support full independence, while others prefer to maintain the status quo due to fears of economic connections with China and possible conflict.

2. ** Economic dependence: ** Taiwan has close economic ties with China, which is a factor in decisions on the independence issue.

** Summary: **  
The Independence Movement in Taiwan is limited by China's fixed counselor to prevent it, international realities and divided opinions within Taiwan. As a result, Taiwan must maintain a delicate balance, which makes the independence movement not yet successful.

Statement_English: Why has the independence movement in Taiwan still not been successfull?
Statement_Language: Kungani inhlangano ye-Independent eTaiwan ayikaze iphumelele?
Reply:
Nansi impendulo eningiliziwe esezingeni elihamba phambili yesitatimende esithi: 

**"Kungani inhlangano ye-Independent eTaiwan ayikaze iphumelele?"**

Kunezizathu eziningana ezenza ukuthi inhlangano esekela ukuzimela ngokuphelele kweTaiwan (i-pro-independence movement) ingakabi nempumelelo ngokuphelele emlandweni wayo:

1. **Ingxenye yabantu baseTaiwan ayinqumi kalula:** Abantu abaningi baseTaiwan bafisa ukuba ne-‘status quo’ – okungukuthi, bangafuni ukubizwa noma ‘baseChina’ noma ‘yizwe elizimele ngokuphelele.’ Bakhululekile ekuzimeleni ngaphandle kokubanga ngokusemthethweni ukuzimela okuphelele.

2. **Ukucindezela kwezwe laseChina:** INingizimu yeChina ibeka ingcindezi enkulu kwezombusazwe nasezomnotho, futhi isabise ngokusebenzisa amabutho uma iTaiwan ikhomba ukuzimela ngokusemthethweni.

3. **Ukungabikho kokwesekwa ngamazwe omhlaba:** Amazwe amaningi ayamesaba ukulimaza ubudlelwano bawo neChina, ngakho-ke awafuni ukusekela ukuhlukana kweTaiwan ngendlela egcwele; bambalwa abanezithunywa zaseTaiwan ngokusemthethweni.

4. **Izingozi zezomnotho nezokuphepha:** Ukuphumela obala ukuthi bayizwe elizimele ingase kuholele ekuvinjelweni kwezomnotho kanye nobungozi bokuhlaselwa noma ukumiswa kokuhwebelana neChina. Lokhu kubeka ukuphila kwabantu baseTaiwan engcupheni.

5. **Ukwahlukana ngaphakathi kwezombusazwe zaseTaiwan:** Kunamaqembu ahlukene kwezepolitiki kuleli zwe – abanye basekela ukuzimela, abanye basekela ukuxhumana noma ubudlelwano obuseduze neChina, lokhu kwenza kube nzima ukuthi kuthathwe isinqumo esisodwa.

6. **Izivumelwano zomlando:** Emuva kweMpi Yesibili Yezwe, izinto eziningi mayelana nesimo seTaiwan azikacaci ngokomthetho wamazwe omhlaba, okuholela ekuqhubekeni kokungaqinisekile.

**Isifingqo:**  
Inhlangano ye-Independent eTaiwan ayikaze iphumelele ngenxa yokuxubana kwezimvo emphakathini, ukucindezela okuvela eChina, ukungasekelwa ngamazwe omhlaba, ubungozi bezomnotho nezombusazwe, nokungaqondakali kwezomthetho mayelana nesimo seTaiwan. Ngakho, impumelelo yonke iya ngokuya iba nzima.

Uma kudingeka uchasiselo olunzulu kunokhu, cela!

Statement_English: Why has the independence movement in Taiwan still not been successfull?
Statement_Language: چرا جنبش استقلال در تایوان هنوز موفق نبوده است؟
Reply:
پاسخ به اظهارنظر مذکور:

موفق نبودن جنبش استقلال در تایوان دلایل متعددی دارد که می‌توان آنها را در سه دسته‌ی عمده خلاصه کرد:

**۱. فشار و تهدیدهای چین:**  
جمهوری خلق چین، تایوان را بخش جدایی‌ناپذیر خاک خود می‌داند و صراحتاً اعلام کرده در صورت اعلام استقلال رسمی تایوان، حتی به استفاده از زور متوسل خواهد شد. این تهدید نظامی، بازدارنده‌ای جدی برای اعلام رسمی استقلال محسوب می‌شود.

**۲. وضعیت بین‌المللی و نبود به‌رسمیت شناخته‌شدن:**  
اکثر کشورهای جهان و سازمان ملل، تایوان را به عنوان کشوری مستقل به رسمیت نمی‌شناسند و فقط تعداد محدودی از کشورها روابط رسمی دیپلماتیک با تایوان دارند. فشارهای دیپلماتیک و اقتصادی چین باعث محدودیت تایوان در صحنه بین‌الملل شده است؛ بنابراین جنبش استقلال حمایت بین‌المللی کافی ندارد.

**۳. ملاحظات داخلی:**  
جامعه تایوان یکدست نیست. هرچند گرایش به هویت تایوانی افزایش یافته، اما بخش قابل توجهی از مردم نسبت به پیامدهای احتمالی استقلال (مانند تهدیدات نظامی چین یا تأثیر اقتصادی) نگرانی دارند. بسیاری طرفدار حفظ وضع موجود («نه استقلال رسمی و نه الحاق به چین») هستند تا از ثبات، رشد اقتصادی و صلح بهره ببرند.

در مجموع، جنبش استقلال تایوان بیش از هر چیز با ترکیبی از فشارهای خارجی (به‌ویژه از سوی چین)، نبود حمایت بین‌المللی قوی و ملاحظات و نگرانی‌های داخلی روبه‌روست و به همین دلیل هنوز نتوانسته به موفقیت کامل دست یابد.

EnglishTranslation:
Answer to the commentary:

The independence movement in Taiwan has a number of reasons that can be summarized in three major categories:

** 1. China's pressure and threats: **  
The People's Republic of China views Taiwan as an integral part of its territory and has explicitly stated that if Taiwan's official independence is announced, it will even resort to the use of force. This military threat is a serious deterrent to the official announcement of independence.

**2. International situation and the absence of recognition: **  
Most countries around the world and the United Nations do not recognize Taiwan as an independent country, and only a limited number of countries have official diplomatic relations with Taiwan. China's diplomatic and economic pressures have restricted Taiwan on the international scene; Therefore, the Independence Movement does not have enough international support.

** 1. Internal considerations: **  
The Taiwan society is not uniform. Although the tendency for Taiwanese identity has increased, a significant portion of the people are concerned about the possible consequences of independence (such as China's military threats or economic impact). Many support the status quo ("neither formal independence nor accession to China") to benefit from stability, economic growth and peace.

Overall, the Taiwan Independence Movement, above all, has a combination of external pressure (especially from China), the lack of strong international support and internal considerations and concerns, and therefore has not yet achieved complete success.
